LAND PREPARATION

The following are the recommended land preparation practices for okra production:

  • Plow the field two to three times.

  • Harrow several times after each plowing to pulverize the soil into finer tilt.

  • Set the furrows at a distance of 80 to 100 cm apart, 3 to 4 days after the last harrowing.

  • Drill the organic fertilizer or compost along the furrows at the rate of 60 bags at 50 kg/bag or 3 tons per hectare.

CROP ESTABLISHMENT

The recommended crop establishment practices for okra are as follows:

  • Sow 2-3 seeds at a distance of 30-40 cm per hill directly in the furrows.

  • Cover the seeds with soil at a depth of 2 to 3 cm.

  • Use 10 kg of seeds for a hectare

  • Plant the seeds on raised beds or on the ridge during rainy season to prevent plants from water logging or submergence in water.

  • Thin out the seedlings, maintaining one (1) to two (2) seedling per hill. Replant missing hills using the seedlings obtained during thinning.

FERTILIZER APPLICATION

The following are the recommended nutrient management practices for okra:

  • Drill along the furrows 40 to 60 bags (2 to 3 tons per hectare) of organic fertilizer or compost per hectare on or prior to planting the seeds.

  • Spray or soil drench tea manure or fermented chicken manure at a ratio of 1:5 tea manure and water at 15, 45, and 60 days after planting.

  • Side dress one bag inorganic fertilizer (urea) 1 month after planting.

 

WATER MANAGEMENT

• Irrigate along the furrows at weekly intervals from sowing to 30 days after planting. 

  • Irrigate at bi-weekly interval thereafter up to harvesting.
